posts.body:
>>5da2139a-0d5e-42ac-8118-f7a2a4b9b627
Well I don't know if it's filled with bots, but it's filled with paid shills for sure. And you notice that when you go to some other imageboards and see the stark difference in the quality of the posts. But there are also too many newfags who don't know any better and imitate the shills, so it's hard to gauge what is shillposting and what is just newfaggotry.

>>0bb78ccb-f9a4-48de-9e5d-208101072d9b
That kind of already exists. You can configure the site to use as much space as you want **within some reasonable limits**.

>>3490bfc4-6679-48c9-b409-416b40d8312f
You can just keep bumping them.

>>eb5a3c21-1ecf-4000-94d2-fe87de12e7ce
You probably need to increase your allotted space for the site both in the sidebar and in the files tab in ZeroNet's homepage.

>>25a0efbd-f7d5-4963-8fe9-222b974e969d
>>12155e57-7675-4643-9474-d699e79739de
Yeah, I deleted it because I realized we have a more fundamental disagreement. I don't think threads with more posts are inherently more worthy of not dying. But if you wanted to prioritize threads with high post count I'm sure you could modify Millchan to tell ZeroNet to delete low post count threads first when running out of space.

>>67f91b1a-dcb8-4e38-b441-cda5dda55949
Yeah looks like we didn't have too many crypto-anarchists on 8chan lol. I wonder where everybody went (besides the v-ch thing).

>>67f91b1a-dcb8-4e38-b441-cda5dda55949
>but there's a whole lot of threads with only one posts and these are usually pretty worthless, as they're either spam or just not interesting.
Sometimes they're just too specific or technical for people to chime in, but still could be interesting for someone searching for exactly that. **Which reminds me, I wonder if there is any way to give this site a search engine**

>>ab2d8c0d-00f0-4ead-8886-3456e42d218d
I wonder if that's mainly because of ZeroID or it would've just happened anyway because of the novelty wearing off.

>>e7cb40ff-6907-4d0f-83f6-7cfd40109e9d
Yeah, as long as we keep all the data.json files locally. But related to what we were talking about, that's not scalable. I don't know if there even is a way of not storing all post histories locally though, since currently data.json files are marked as 'required' files, and I don't know if it'd be possible to mark them as optional and still have the site work.

>>8e3797c7-b491-43e8-9d53-004d72359d8b
Are you sure the spam wave isn't the big red peak?

>>3bfc34c6-e7e4-428b-ac2f-e08eb631de42
I don't know about that.
Looks like the ZeroTalk admin (nofish, also ZN's developer) manually has to  increase the size limit for each user every time it approaches the max. http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1566746537_1GP1GwsgiyybaHxGxfTEbsMCqRS9ogd1nJ/What+do+I+do+about+the+ZeroTalk+space+limit
Pretty ridiculous tbh.

>>33ec8143-5d66-47e0-88b9-3d9d11ae063a
Here the size limit for the required files (so data.json basically since it's the only required file) is 5 megs for each user, over there it's more like 50KB apparently. There's no limit for optional files (images videos etc you name it).

>>46b2a77a-f3d8-411e-8d03-410dd3a16d5b
Yeah maybe by the time that becomes a problem ZeroNet will become obsolete and some other thing will take its place.
